intro: Mitscherlichia trichopoda, commonly known as the hairy mitscherlichia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Mitscherlichia trichopoda is a perennial herb that is adapted to withstand arid conditions and is often used in xeriscaping.
